column4: Ok, so I'm in my new Ubuntu Netbook Remix install, and it's kind of a shock to the system (I'm coming from years of Gentoo with Enlightenment...only thing that starts up is xclock!)
is this something I can 'fix' or is this just how it is, and I should maybe drop back to normal Ubuntu?
I don't really understand your problem. You only get the clock to boot?
heh, no, no.....on my main desktop and laptop I run pretty minimalist (gentoo with enlightenment), and now I'm in netbook remix and it's like *BOOM! Stuff!!*
It's pretty awesome.. Running it as we speak on my mini netbook
and I'm not sure I'm ready for all this stuff...is this something I can tone down, or is this just now netbook remix 'is' and maybe I should fall back to normal Ubuntu?
Yeah, I can see why people would like it
You can remove programs etc..
can I change window manager?
sure, but how big is your screen?
10.1"  I think if I poke around a bit, get rid of everything, and set up keybindings to launch things, I'll be alright
Then you'll love it.. open up firefox.. see how it melts in the panel
Theres so much space for everythin else
For me it was love at first sight
Yeah, it's cool looking, it's just not how I"m used to working :D
well yeah, maybe, but I wanted to try out Ubuntu rather than do another Gentoo box...figured it'd play nicer out of the box with the netbook hardware (and so far it has!)
Think I'll try it for a few days
why not install the desktop version and customize it the way you want?
heh, because I bought a netbook and went 'ooh, a distro meant for netbooks'
If your into google stuffs try gOS out, pretty neat to
Really sweet appeance
oh, I just installed pidgin
er....not sure. what's the notifier icon?
out of curiousity, what programs r u gettin?
